t: 1 Thessalonians 5
But*p of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.
For*p yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.
For*p when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.
But*p ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.
Ye*p are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.
Therefore*p let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.
For*p they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.
But*p let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.
For*p God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,
Who*p died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.
Wherefore*p comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.
And*p we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;
And*p to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. And be at peace among yourselves.
Now*p we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men.
See*p that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.
Rejoice*p evermore.
Pray*p without ceasing.
In*p every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.
Quench*p not the Spirit.
Despise*p not prophesyings.
Prove*p all things; hold fast that which is good.
Abstain*p from all appearance of evil.
And*p the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Faithful*p is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
Brethren,*p pray for us.
Greet*p all the brethren with an holy kiss.
I*p charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.
The*p grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
